Reason: The configuration option 'compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact the system's performance. This configuration controls the rate at which data compaction occurs, which directly affects the system's disk I/O operations and overall throughput. A higher value can lead to increased disk usage and potentially slower performance, while a lower value may result in more efficient compaction but could also impact overall system performance. Therefore, any changes to this configuration can have notable variations in execution time and memory consumption, making it a performance-sensitive setting.
